critique: This executive order withdraws public lands in Alaska for use by the War Department as a cantonment site. It prioritizes national security during wartime. There's no indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or social inclusion. It expands executive power by withdrawing land but states it will be revoked when no longer needed. It favors federal control over land use. It leans towards national security over individual use of land. There's no economic regulation involved.
